Sentencas: Multi-component gas diffusion in the continuum flow regime is often modelled using the Stefan - Maxwell (SM) equations.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries

Sentencas: Recent advances in lattice Boltzmann (LB) mass diffusion models have made it possible to directly compare LB predictions with solutions to the SM equations.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries

Sentencas: In this work, one-dimensional (1D) and two-dimensional (2D), equi-molar counter-diffusion of two gases in the presence of a third, inert gas is studied.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries

Sentencas: The work is an extension and validation of a recently proposed binary LB model for components having dissimilar molecular weights.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries

Sentencas: The treatment of inflow and outflow boundary conditions ( for specifying species mole fractions or mole flux) is developed via the averaging of component velocities before and after collisions.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries

Sentencas: Results for one and two spatial dimensions have been compared with analytic and numerical solutions to the SM equations and good agreement has been found for a wide range of parameters and for large variations in molecular weights.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries

Sentencas: A novel molecular weight tuning strategy for increasing the accuracy has been demonstrated.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries

Sentencas: The model developed can be used to model continuum, multi-component mass transfer in complex geometries such as porous media without empirical modification of diffusion coefficients based on porosity and tortuosity values.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries

Sentencas: An envisioned application of this technique is to model gas diffusion in porous solid oxide fuel cell electrodes.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for continuum, multi-component mass diffusion in complex 2D geometries
